p: Some studies suggest that the cardiac damage secondary to SARS-CoV-2 may be linked to ACE2, present in the cell membrane of CV, lung, and kidney tissues. The physiological role of ACE2 is to perform the conversion of angiotensin II in a molecule of angiotensin 1–7, causing vasodilation and decrease of hydric retention, through Mas receptor, acting as counter-regulator of the blood pressure elevation [ 31].
